name: GRIB
description: GRIdded Binary format, a standard for encoding meteorological and oceanographic data.

name: Network Common Data Form
description: A flexible, self-describing format used to store multidimensional scientific data (e.g., time, latitude, longitude, altitude).

name: Binary Universal Form for the Representation of meteorological data
description: A binary format designed for the efficient transmission and storage of real-time observational data. Supports complex, hierarchical data.

name: Hierarchical Data Format
description: A set of file formats designed to store and organize large amounts of numerical data, common in satellite and remote sensing data.

name: Climate and Forecast Metadata Conventions
description: A metadata standard that ensures NetCDF files are self-describing and interoperable. Defines variable names, units, and spatial/temporal dimensions.

name: ISO 19115 / 19139 (Geographic Metadata Standards)
description: Standards from the ISO 19100 series for documenting datasets with geospatial content, commonly used in climate data cataloging and discovery.

name: Surface Synoptic Observations
description: Reports surface weather observations from land-based stations, including temperature, pressure, wind, cloud cover, and weather phenomena.

name: Meteorological Aerodrome Report
description: Provides aviation weather reports, including wind, visibility, weather conditions, cloud cover, temperature, dew point, and pressure.

name: Terminal Aerodrome Forecast
description: Forecast counterpart to METAR, providing wind, visibility, significant weather, and cloud forecasts for airports in time blocks.

name: Upper-Air Sounding Reports
description: Structured codes reporting upper-air observations from radiosondes, including temperature, humidity, wind, and geopotential height.

name: Marine Observations
description: Reports from buoys and ships, including wave height, sea surface temperature, and swell, adapted for marine conditions.

name: CLIMAT
description: Monthly summaries of surface observations reported to global climate monitoring centres for climate monitoring.

name: CLIMAT TEMP
description: Monthly summaries of upper-air observations reported to global climate monitoring centres for climate monitoring.

name: Aircraft Routine Reports
description: Routine in-flight reports from aircraft, focusing on observed conditions like turbulence and icing.

name: Pilot Reports
description: In-flight reports issued by pilots, detailing conditions such as turbulence, icing, and other weather phenomena.

name: Web Map Service
description: Delivers georeferenced map images over the web, used for visualizing weather radar, satellite images, or climate model outputs.

name: Web Feature Service
description: Provides access to vector data (e.g., points, lines, polygons) with attributes, typically encoded in GML.

name: Web Coverage Service
description: Allows access to raster data (coverages), such as temperature grids or precipitation fields, often used with NetCDF or HDF.

name: Catalogue Service for the Web
description: Enables discovery and querying of metadata about geospatial datasets and services using ISO 19115-compliant metadata.

name: Sensor Observation Service
description: Provides access to real-time or archived sensor observations, using SensorML and O&M standards.

name: OGC SensorThings API
description: A lightweight, RESTful API for IoT, designed for streaming sensor data in JSON format.

name: Geography Markup Language
description: An XML-based encoding for geospatial features, used in services like WFS and SOS.

name: NetCDF with CF Conventions
description: OGC-approved standard combining NetCDF data format with CF metadata conventions for gridded climate and oceanographic data.
